messages.content: Even people who disagree with Kate say she is a fearless, honest campaigner who fights for her constituents.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposed the Iraq War, ID Cards and tuition fees; backed support for child refugees, rights at work and same-sex marriage.
Has a spotless expenses record and helped bring down the Commons Speaker who tried to cover for expenses cheats; always clearly sets out her beliefs and pledges at elections and follows them through.
Exposed Garden Bridge costs & sweetheart deals despite establishment approval; helped uncover wrongdoing at Kids’ Company charity.
Has helped tens of thousands of constituents with vast problems, from housing and benefits, to immigration and schooling.
Speaks out for those who are suffering under this government- the underpaid, the disabled, pensioners in poverty and the homeless. Opposing sell-offs of local community centres.

issues.economy: By supporting George Osborne’s first six Budgets, the Lib Dems cut the tax rates of millionaires and increased VAT, slashed funding for public services and support for the vulnerable. They failed to eliminate the deficit or reduce national debt.
issues.education: Having pledged to abolish tuition fees, the Lib Dems tripled them.
issues.health: They voted through the reorganisation of the NHS, wasting £3billion, opening it up to more privatisation and laying the foundations for the crisis we see today.
issues.lawCrime: They presided over large cuts to our police, but voted for increasing state powers to snoop on the public, like the Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Act and Secret Courts.
issues.socialWelfare: They enabled ever-harsher sanctions on unemployed people, including the disabled. They brought in the bedroom tax that has caused immense harm to so many vulnerable people trying to live in their family home.

community.content: Opposing sell-offs of local community centres.

contactInformation.address: Office 2 Rear, Houghton Square, London, SW9 9AN

Even people who disagree with Kate say she is a fearless, honest campaigner who fights for her constituents.
Opposing sell-offs of local community centres.

By supporting George Osborne’s first six Budgets, the Lib Dems cut the tax rates of millionaires and increased VAT, slashed funding for public services and support for the vulnerable.
Having pledged to abolish tuition fees, the Lib Dems tripled them.
They voted through the reorganisation of the NHS, wasting £3billion, opening it up to more privatisation and laying the foundations for the crisis we see today.
They enabled ever-harsher sanctions on unemployed people, including the disabled.
They brought in the bedroom tax that has caused immense harm to so many vulnerable people trying to live in their family home.
They presided over large cuts to our police, but voted for increasing state powers to snoop on the public, like the Data Retention and Investigatory Powers Act and Secret Courts.
